title: How to Wash an Electric Blanket
steps: Do not dry clean your electric blanket.
Do not iron an electric blanket.
Inspect the blanket after washing and drying.
Take care at the laundromat.

title: How to Clean a Clothes Dryer Vent
steps: Learn the signs your vent needs cleaning.
Keep the floor around the dryer clean.
Limit the use of dryer sheets.
Stick to brief dry cycles.

title: How to Clean Toddler's Teeth
steps: Start in infancy.
Use toddler tooth care products.
Floss.
Start brushing your toddler's teeth!.
Go to the dentist.
Give your child drinking water that is fluoridated.
Make sure your toddler is getting a well-balanced diet.

title: How to Free Your Child from Lice
steps: Avoid sharing.
Ensure hair hygiene.
Teach your children steps to avoid lice.
Make sure your child's school or organization checks for lice.
Look for the telltale signs of a louse.
Check your child’s hair.

title: How to Teach Your Kid to Use a Zipper
steps: Model zipper use.
Have your child practice zipping with your help.
Remove any unnecessary challenges.
Give your child opportunities to practice zipping.
Give positive reinforcement.
Reward your child for a job well done.

title: How to Teach Your Children to Do Laundry
steps: Make the laundry area child-friendly.
Have young children participate with safe tasks.
Make laundry fun for older kids.
Encourage teenagers to be more independent.

title: How to Clean a Toddler's Ears
steps: Look into your child's ears to check for foreign objects.
Never insert a cotton swab or other item into your child's ear.
Watch for signs that your child may be having ear pain.

title: How to Teach Your Child to Wash Dishes
steps: Load the dishwasher with pre-rinsed plates.
Instruct your child how to put soap in the dishwasher and how to begin the wash cycle.
Complete the wash cycle.

title: How to Get a Toddler to Wear Winter Clothes
steps: Choose clothes that are easy to pull on.
Get your toddler to practice wearing their winter clothes.
Pack their summer clothes.
Make getting dressed a familiar routine.
Avoid forcing your toddler to wear the winter clothes.

title: How to Wash a Toddler's Clothes
steps: Determine what temperature of water you will use.
Choose a detergent.
Figure out how you should dry the clothes.
Add dryer sheets if so desired.

title: How to Change Your Toddler's Clothes Without a Tantrum
steps: Lay out any items and clothing that you need ahead of time.
Dress your child first thing in the morning.
Leave plenty of time to change your child.
Pick clothes that are comfortable and easy.

title: How to Do Baby's Laundry
steps: Remove all tags from new clothes, blankets, and sheets.
Sort through hand-me-downs thoroughly.
Wash baby's clothes as you would any other clothes.
Put the clothes in the dryer.
Fold laundry and put away.
Keep baby's dirty clothes in a separate basket.
